body:
Hello, thank you for your interest in our work! Unfortunately this is beyond our understanding of the subject matter. We will leave the issue open in case anyone else can help. 

Please note that most technical problems are due to:

- **Your changes to the default repository**. If your issue is not reproducible in a fresh `git clone` version of this repository we can not debug it. Before going further run this code and ensure your issue persists:
```bash
sudo rm -rf yolov3  # remove exising repo
git clone https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov3 && cd yolov3 # git clone latest
python3 detect.py  # verify detection
python3 train.py  # verify training (a few batches only)
# CODE TO REPRODUCE YOUR ISSUE HERE
```
- **Your custom data.** If your issue is not reproducible with COCO data we can not debug it. Visit our [Custom Training Tutorial](https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov3/wiki/https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov3/wiki/Train-Custom-Data) for exact details on how to format your custom data. Examine `train_batch0.jpg` and `test_batch0.jpg` for a sanity check of training and testing data.
- **Your environment.** If your issue is not reproducible in a [GCP Quickstart Guide](https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov3/wiki/GCP-Quickstart) VM we can not debug it. Ensure you meet the requirements specified in the README: Unix, MacOS, or Windows with Python >= 3.7, Pytorch >= 1.0, etc.

Any Body has Conver the trained-model to serialized-model which can be called by libtorch c++?

Have you solved the problem? @shadyatscu

> Thanks for your teams great work! I tried to make the trained yolov3 model callable by C++, from the official reference there are two methods: trace and script annotation. When i use the script annotation method, i modified the model function follow the instructions like this:
> 
> #class Darknet(nn.Module):
> class Darknet(torch.jit.ScriptModule):
> def **init**(self, cfg, img_size=(416, 416)):
> super(Darknet, self).**init**()
> 
> ```
>     self.module_defs = parse_model_cfg(cfg)
>     self.module_defs[0]['cfg'] = cfg
>     self.module_defs[0]['height'] = img_size
>     self.hyperparams, self.module_list = create_modules(self.module_defs)
>     self.yolo_layers = get_yolo_layers(self)
> 
>     # Needed to write header when saving weights
>     self.header_info = np.zeros(5, dtype=np.int32)  # First five are header values
>     self.seen = self.header_info[3]  # number of images seen during training
> 
> @torch.jit.script_method
> def forward(self, x, var=None):
>     img_size = max(x.shape[-2:])
>     layer_outputs = []
>     output = []
> ```
> 
> , at the same time i modified some statements unsupported by torch.jit. However a error"RuntimeError: cannot instantiate class object (ModuleList) inside jit.script'' can not be fixed all the time. Could you give me some advices to fix it and is anybody also tries to make the model callable by c++?

Have you Convert the trained-model succesfully? @shadyatscu

> > Thanks for your teams great work! I tried to make the trained yolov3 model callable by C++, from the official reference there are two methods: trace and script annotation. When i use the script annotation method, i modified the model function follow the instructions like this:
> > #class Darknet(nn.Module):
> > class Darknet(torch.jit.ScriptModule):
> > def **init**(self, cfg, img_size=(416, 416)):
> > super(Darknet, self).**init**()
> > ```
> >     self.module_defs = parse_model_cfg(cfg)
> >     self.module_defs[0]['cfg'] = cfg
> >     self.module_defs[0]['height'] = img_size
> >     self.hyperparams, self.module_list = create_modules(self.module_defs)
> >     self.yolo_layers = get_yolo_layers(self)
> > 
> >     # Needed to write header when saving weights
> >     self.header_info = np.zeros(5, dtype=np.int32)  # First five are header values
> >     self.seen = self.header_info[3]  # number of images seen during training
> > 
> > @torch.jit.script_method
> > def forward(self, x, var=None):
> >     img_size = max(x.shape[-2:])
> >     layer_outputs = []
> >     output = []
> > ```
> > 
> > 
> > , at the same time i modified some statements unsupported by torch.jit. However a error"RuntimeError: cannot instantiate class object (ModuleList) inside jit.script'' can not be fixed all the time. Could you give me some advices to fix it and is anybody also tries to make the model callable by c++?
> 
> Have you Convert the trained-model succesfully? @shadyatscu

Do you solve the problem now?

> > > Thanks for your teams great work! I tried to make the trained yolov3 model callable by C++, from the official reference there are two methods: trace and script annotation. When i use the script annotation method, i modified the model function follow the instructions like this:
> > > #class Darknet(nn.Module):
> > > class Darknet(torch.jit.ScriptModule):
> > > def **init**(self, cfg, img_size=(416, 416)):
> > > super(Darknet, self).**init**()
> > > ```
> > >     self.module_defs = parse_model_cfg(cfg)
> > >     self.module_defs[0]['cfg'] = cfg
> > >     self.module_defs[0]['height'] = img_size
> > >     self.hyperparams, self.module_list = create_modules(self.module_defs)
> > >     self.yolo_layers = get_yolo_layers(self)
> > > 
> > >     # Needed to write header when saving weights
> > >     self.header_info = np.zeros(5, dtype=np.int32)  # First five are header values
> > >     self.seen = self.header_info[3]  # number of images seen during training
> > > 
> > > @torch.jit.script_method
> > > def forward(self, x, var=None):
> > >     img_size = max(x.shape[-2:])
> > >     layer_outputs = []
> > >     output = []
> > > ```
> > > 
> > > 
> > > , at the same time i modified some statements unsupported by torch.jit. However a error"RuntimeError: cannot instantiate class object (ModuleList) inside jit.script'' can not be fixed all the time. Could you give me some advices to fix it and is anybody also tries to make the model callable by c++?
> > 
> > 
> > Have you Convert the trained-model succesfully? @shadyatscu
> 
> Do you solve the problem now?

yes

> > > > Thanks for your teams great work! I tried to make the trained yolov3 model callable by C++, from the official reference there are two methods: trace and script annotation. When i use the script annotation method, i modified the model function follow the instructions like this:
> > > > #class Darknet(nn.Module):
> > > > class Darknet(torch.jit.ScriptModule):
> > > > def **init**(self, cfg, img_size=(416, 416)):
> > > > super(Darknet, self).**init**()
> > > > ```
> > > >     self.module_defs = parse_model_cfg(cfg)
> > > >     self.module_defs[0]['cfg'] = cfg
> > > >     self.module_defs[0]['height'] = img_size
> > > >     self.hyperparams, self.module_list = create_modules(self.module_defs)
> > > >     self.yolo_layers = get_yolo_layers(self)
> > > > 
> > > >     # Needed to write header when saving weights
> > > >     self.header_info = np.zeros(5, dtype=np.int32)  # First five are header values
> > > >     self.seen = self.header_info[3]  # number of images seen during training
> > > > 
> > > > @torch.jit.script_method
> > > > def forward(self, x, var=None):
> > > >     img_size = max(x.shape[-2:])
> > > >     layer_outputs = []
> > > >     output = []
> > > > ```
> > > > 
> > > > 
> > > > , at the same time i modified some statements unsupported by torch.jit. However a error"RuntimeError: cannot instantiate class object (ModuleList) inside jit.script'' can not be fixed all the time. Could you give me some advices to fix it and is anybody also tries to make the model callable by c++?
> > > 
> > > 
> > > Have you Convert the trained-model succesfully? @shadyatscu
> > 
> > 
> > Do you solve the problem now?
> 
> yes

Could you please tell me why this error occur how you solve it, thanks.

I just use jit.trace, not jit.script,  you can figure out the error acoording to the official document.
@Simona787

Thank you for your advice.  But in my case trace is not feasible bacuase control flow is involved. Thanks anyway. 


 
---Original---

control flow means the outputs depends on the input x，if inputs x changed , the trace(or operation on x) of x will change .
Iit do not matter if the "control flow" is just associated with constant not the x
@Fighting-JJ Hello, can you tell me how to solve this problem？
